description: A giant fair in downtown Washington, a mixed martial arts competition at the White House and a monument honoring national heroes: The American president plans to give the celebrations a resolutely patriotic tone, glossing over the darker chapters of the country's history.

headline: Frontex unlawfully shared thousands of people's personal data with European police
description: In the name of combating migrant smugglers, the European Union's border surveillance agency spent years collecting information on migrants and civil society activists deemed 'suspect,' before passing it on to Europol, the EU police cooperation agency.

headline: The Swiss should drink more wine, says minister
description: While the government dutifully promotes public health, the minister of the economy and agriculture is expressing concern over the struggles of the country's wine industry.

headline: From Rafah to Paris, Fadel Afana's journey as a psychiatrist in exile
description: A witness to the deterioration of mental health among the inhabitants of the Gaza Strip since 2008, the Palestinian practitioner arrived in Paris in October 2024. Thanks to the PAUSE program, he now works as part of a team of researchers from INSERM.

Tax on ultra-rich: 'France has the opportunity to lead the way,' say Nobel Prize-winning economists
description: As public deficits balloon and extreme wealth explode, creating a minimum tax on the assets of billionaires should be a priority, argue seven Nobel Prize-winning economists in an op-ed for Le Monde.

headline: The Oder Bridge between Germany and Poland: The decline of a European symbol
description: After Berlin reinstated border checks to block migrants at the bridge in Frankfurt an der Oder, Warsaw responded with similar measures, disrupting daily life for locals. Once emblematic of the European Union's eastward expansion, the site now bears witness to the rise of xenophobic sentiment.

headline: The relentless rush to build dams in China's Tiger Leaping Gorge: 'If we lose our land, we lose everything'
description: 'The Himalayas Overheating' (5/6). In the far southwest of China, plans to build massive reservoirs as part of hydroelectric dam projects have condemned dozens of mountain villages to disappear.
